intro: Galinsoga linearifolia, commonly known as slender gallant, is a flowering plant native to the Americas. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant has slender, linear leaves and produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. It is often found in disturbed soils and is considered an invasive species in some regions. Galinsoga linearifolia is known for its rapid growth and ability to thrive in a variety of environmental conditions.
